page.title: 11The disused railway.
page.content: In researching local history we have found that this railway line was originally called the Buckingham railway. It was opened for passenges on Ist.May 1850 from Bletchley to Banbury. In 1878 the London North Western Railway Company (L.N.W.R.) built another line from Cockley Brake to Blisworth. It is this line that cuts diagonally across our area. The presence of the disused track has had an effect on the ecology of the area. It has provided a sanctuary for wildlife and many of the animals, insects and plants find a home along the old cuttings. Most of the track can still be walked but farmers have blocked parts of the way with mounds of soil. We walked the track and found many of the plants and animals listed with our ecology work.
